Automotive & Engineering

Hearing Screening for Automotive & Engineering Workshops

Hearing Tests for Mechanical & Engineering Workplaces

Request a Quote Today

Automotive and engineering workshops are exposed to engine noise, air tools, welding equipment, compressors, and test rigs — often in enclosed environments where noise is amplified.

Our workshop hearing screening service protects skilled technicians while ensuring legal compliance.

Why Hearing Screening Matters in Workshops

Mechanical Noise Exposure

Prolonged exposure to mechanical noise

Diagnostic Essential

Hearing is essential for diagnostics and safety

Protect Skilled Workers

Protects long-term skilled employees

Compliance Support

Supports insurance and compliance requirements

What Happens During the Test

Work-Environment Noise Assessment

Understanding specific workshop conditions

Otoscopic Ear Check

Visual examination of ear health

Audiometric Hearing Screening

Professional hearing level assessment

Immediate Explanation of Results

Clear communication on the day

Follow-Up Guidance If Required

Next steps and recommendations

Who This Service Is For

Mechanics & Technicians

Engineers & Fabricators

MOT Testers

Automotive & Engineering Workshop Hearing Screening – FAQs

Yes. Where noise exposure reaches legal action levels, hearing screening is required under workplace noise regulations.

Air tools, compressors, welding equipment, engine testing systems, and fabrication machinery present the highest risk.

Yes. Reduced hearing can impact diagnostics accuracy, safety awareness, and effective communication on the workshop floor.

Yes. Hearing tests are quick and designed to fit seamlessly into normal workshop operations.

We provide clear guidance on next steps, including further assessment and recommendations for protective controls.

Yes. We work with single-site independent workshops as well as large engineering and industrial facilities.
